marker_definitions.asyncio: Async tests (mapped to anyio via anyio plugin)
marker_definitions.flaky: Known flaky tests that may need retries
marker_definitions.real_api: Tests that hit real Coinbase APIs (opt-in)
marker_definitions.slow: High-duration tests gated from default dev runs
marker_definitions.uses_mock_broker: Tests that depend on the deterministic broker (legacy MockBroker path; skipped by default)
marker_definitions.uses_real_preferences: Tests that read or write real TUI preferences

Property: Slippage failures should trigger pause exactly at threshold.

The pause should be triggered when count >= threshold, and counter resets.
tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.name: test_slippage_failure_escalation

tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.docstring:
Property: Broker failures should trigger global pause exactly at threshold.

Counter resets after pause is triggered.
tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.name: test_broker_failure_escalation

tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.docstring:
Property: reset_slippage_failures should reset the counter.

Subsequent failures start from zero.

tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.docstring: Property: reset_broker_failures should reset the counter.
tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.name: test_broker_counter_resets_on_success

tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.docstring:
Property: Global pause should be active immediately after calling pause_all.

is_paused() should return True when not reduce-only (or reduce-only not allowed).
tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.name: test_global_pause_is_active_during_duration

tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.docstring:
Property: Symbol pause should only affect the paused symbol.

Other symbols should remain unpaused.
tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.name: test_symbol_pause_is_isolated

tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.docstring:
Property: Global pause should take precedence over symbol pause.

When both are active, global pause properties should apply.

tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.name: test_reduce_only_consistency_global

tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.name: test_reduce_only_consistency_symbol

tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.docstring:
Property: Multiple symbol pauses should be independent.

Each symbol can be paused/unpaused independently.
tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.name: test_multiple_symbol_pauses_are_independent

tests/property/test_degradation_invarian.name: test_clear_all_removes_all_pauses

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_calcu.docstring:
Property: Fees should always be non-negative.

No matter the input, fees should never be negative.
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_calcu.name: test_fee_non_negative

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_calcu.docstring:
Property: Fees should be proportional to notional value.

fee = notional * rate_bps / 10000
Doubling notional should double the fee.
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_calcu.name: test_fee_proportional_to_notional

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_calcu.docstring: Property: Fee calculation should match the formula: fee = notional * rate_bps / 10000.
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_calcu.name: test_fee_formula_correctness

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_calcu.docstring: Property: Zero notional should result in zero fee.
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_calcu.name: test_zero_notional_zero_fee

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_calcu.docstring:
Property: Fee of sum equals sum of fees.

fee(a + b) = fee(a) + fee(b)
This property enables accurate aggregation of fees.
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_calcu.name: test_fee_additivity

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_tiers.docstring:
Property: Maker fees should always be less than or equal to taker fees.

This is a fundamental market structure property - makers add liquidity
and should be rewarded with lower fees.
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_tiers.name: test_maker_fee_leq_taker_fee

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_tiers.docstring:
Property: Higher volume tiers should have lower or equal fees.

As volume increases, traders get better rates.
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_tiers.name: test_fee_tiers_monotonically_decrease

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_tiers.docstring:
Property: Rate percentage should be correctly converted from basis points.

rate_pct = rate_bps / 100
e.g., 25 bps = 0.25%
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_tiers.name: test_rate_percentage_conversion

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_tiers.docstring: Verify fee tier rates are internally consistent.
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_tiers.name: TestFeeRatesConsistency::test_fee_tier_rates_consistency

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_tiers.docstring: Verify TIER_7 has the lowest rates.
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_tiers.name: TestFeeRatesConsistency::test_highest_tier_lowest_rates

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_tiers.docstring: Verify fee calculation matches documented example.
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_tiers.name: TestFeeRatesConsistency::test_fee_calculation_example

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_volum.docstring:
Property: Volume tracking should correctly upgrade tiers as volume accumulates.

Tier thresholds:
- TIER_0: < $10K
- TIER_1: $10K-$50K
- TIER_2: $50K-$100K
- TIER_3: $100K-$1M
- etc.
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_volum.name: test_volume_tracking_tier_upgrades

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_volum.docstring: Property: Resetting volume should clear the tracker and potentially change tier.
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_volum.name: test_volume_reset_clears_tracking

tests/property/test_fee_invariants_volum.docstring: Verify volume tracking disabled keeps tier constant.
tests/property/test_fee_invariants_volum.name: test_volume_tracking_disabled_no_tier_change

tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.docstring:
Property: Distance to liquidation calculations are mathematically consistent.

- distance_bps = distance_pct * 100 (basis points = percentage * 100)
- Long: positive distance when current > liq (safe), negative when current < liq
- Short: positive distance when liq > current (safe), negative when liq < current
tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.name: test_distance_calculation_invariants

tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.docstring:
Property: Risk levels follow a strict ordering based on distance.

- safe: distance > warning_buffer
- warning: critical_buffer < distance <= warning_buffer
- critical: 0 < distance <= critical_buffer
- liquidated: distance <= 0

The guards (reduce_only, reject_entry) should be consistent with risk levels.
tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.name: test_risk_level_invariants

tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.docstring:
Property: Zero position size should always result in 'safe' risk level.

This is a critical safety property - we should never flag risk on empty positions.
tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.name: test_zero_position_is_always_safe

tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.docstring:
Property: Liquidation price is always positioned correctly relative to entry.

For long positions: liquidation_price < entry_price (liquidated when price drops)
For short positions: liquidation_price > entry_price (liquidated when price rises)

Exception: Very high leverage with high maintenance margin can violate this,
but the formulas should still be mathematically consistent.
tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.name: test_liquidation_price_invariants

tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.docstring: Verify the liquidation formula matches documentation.
tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.name: TestLiquidationPropertyBased::test_liquidation_price_formula_documented

tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.docstring:
Property: Long and short liquidation prices should be symmetric around entry.

If a long is liquidated X% below entry, a short should be liquidated X% above entry
(with same leverage and margin rate).
tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.name: test_liquidation_symmetry

tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.docstring:
Property: Higher leverage should result in liquidation price closer to entry.

This is fundamental to leveraged trading - more leverage = more risk = tighter liquidation.
tests/property/test_liquidation_invarian.name: test_higher_leverage_closer_liquidation

tests/property/test_margin_invariants_co.docstring: Property: Margin requirements should increase with more notional.
tests/property/test_margin_invariants_co.name: test_margin_requirements_scale_with_positions

tests/unit/gpt_trader/tui/test_screens.p.docstring:
Test that update_ui correctly sets screen state for StateRegistry broadcast.

With the StateRegistry pattern, update_ui() sets self.state which triggers
watch_state() -> StateRegistry.broadcast(). Widgets that implement StateObserver
receive updates via their on_state_updated() method rather than direct property
assignment from MainScreen.
tests/unit/gpt_trader/tui/test_screens.p.name: TestMainScreen::test_update_ui
